title: Alabama A&M band honors 'Cupcake' McKinney during halftime show after 3-year-old's body found
text:
CLOSE

RIP, Cupcake.

During the Magic City Classic on Saturday, Alabama A&M's band honored Kamille "Cupcake" McKinney, missing in Birmingham for 10 days before her body was found, with a tribute during its halftime performance, spelling out "CUPCAKE."

The band played "Jesus Loves Me" and waved purple flags.

Seven minutes before kickoff at the 78th Classic between A&M and Alabama State, a moment of silence also was held for Cupcake. A hush fell over the crowd finding its way through the bleachers of Birmingham's Legion Field.

A fitting mood, considering the charcoal gray skies that hung over the field and the skyline of downtown Birmingham.

Cupcake McKinney is honored by Alabama A&M's band at halftime of the Magic City Classic (Photo: Andre Toran/Advertiser)

The Magic City Classic is known as an event of solitude and a gathering of black culture and pride, and the remembrance of McKinney's death amid the festivities makes the definition of the latter event more evident.

McKinney was initially reported missing Oct. 12 after being abducted from a birthday party.

Authorities found the 3-year-old Birmingham girl's body in a dumpster at a landfill Tuesday. The cause of death was ruled asphyxiation by suffocation on the same day McKinney was kidnapped, according to a report by AL.com.

Kamille McKinney (Photo: Alabama Law Enforcement Agency)

Thursday, Birmingham authorities charged two people with capital murder and abduction in connection with her death. The two assailants, according Birmingham Police Chief Patrick D. Smith, are 39-year-old Patrick Devone Stallworth and his girlfriend, Derick Irisha Brown, 29.

According to Birmingham authorities, the couple was initially taken into custody on unrelated charges connected to another case.

Tuesday, Smith concluded that there was no connection between the assailants and McKinney's family.
description: The Alabama A&M band played "Jesus Loves Me" and waved purple flags. The 3-year-old Birmingham girl's body was found in dumpster at a landfill Tuesday
